alert.note: Alert for Coastal Brunswick; Coastal New Hanover; Coastal Pender; Inland Brunswick; Inland New Hanover; Inland Pender (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 06 at 10:58PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of New Hanover, southern Pender and eastern Brunswick Counties through MIDNIGHT EDT... At 1058 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Brunswick County Community College Main Campus, or 7 miles north of Oak Island, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Wilmington, Leland, Oak Island, Carolina Beach, Wrightsville Beach, Kure Beach, Holden Beach, Caswell Beach, Bald Head Island, Snows Cut, South Masonboro Island, Ocean Crest Pier, Yaupon Beach, Figure Eight Island, North Masonboro Island, Hampstead, Boiling Spring Lakes, St. James, Southport and Northwest. People attending Riverfront Concerts (Weekday) may be affected by this storm and are urged to follow the precautionary measures of the onsite officials. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between mile markers 404 and 416. Interstate 140 US Route 17 in Brunswick County between mile markers 22 and 44. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
